instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging Light Blinks with Battery Connected
threads.message:
Hi
I have Motherboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Board is working fine with battery or Direct with charger but If battery is connected then it's start blinking like cutting of power.
Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, Checked <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR>, No Corrosion so far. 
Any Suggestions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging Light Blinks with Battery Connected
threads.message:
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with charger only (no battery).
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging Light Blinks with Battery Connected
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with charger only (no battery) 20V which should be around 12.4V
Resistance between pins 17/18 is 4.3 Ohm and 27/28 is 21Ohm of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging Light Blinks with Battery Connected
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure both R/<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging Light Blinks with Battery Connected
threads.message:
R/<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> are Good.
After Replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> Problem Solved, I got nice 12.54V and Solid Light on Charger with Battery 

Thank You So Much 
Problem Solved
